multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: equities; Sports stocks and dividend yield relative to S&P 500, Fed policy drives rates.

category.motivation: The article reports a corporate action—doubling dividend and expanding credit facility—constituting a company update.

impact.motivation: The article reports a significant corporate event—doubling the dividend, securing large media rights deals, and expanding credit—that directly impacts TKO’s financial health and stock valuation.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports a specific corporate dividend increase and new media deals, which are immediate events affecting the node.

article_node.title: UFC, WWE Parent TKO Doubles Dividend on Heels of Rights Deals
article_node.summary: TKO Group Holdings has doubled its quarterly dividend to $0.76 per share, a $150 million payout, driven by new U.S. media rights deals: a seven‑year, $1.1 billion‑per‑year UFC contract with Paramount Skydance and a five‑year, $1.6 billion WWE deal with ESPN. The move lifts TKO’s dividend yield to 1.64%, above the S&P 500’s 1.2%, and signals confidence in the company’s cash flow. TKO also plans to expand its credit facility by up to $1 billion to support future growth.
